definition: to obtain by an effort/to strive to get sth
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished

sentences.english: The couple had a heck of an argument and kept us awake all night.
sentences.chinese: 爭得夠嗆，弄得咱們一晚上沒眨眼皮。

sentences.english: He has a competive quarrel with his boss.
sentences.chinese: 他和老闆爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: So it is what that drives you to move forward and to pursue the unlimited wealth with unremitting efforts?
sentences.chinese: 是什麼促使您執著向前，去爭得明擺著花不完的財富？

sentences.english: You can talk things over, or even argue, with your boss.
sentences.chinese: 你可以和老闆討論事情，甚至可以爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: Monica and Ross compete for the "Geller Cup."
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡和羅斯爲家族的“蓋勒杯”爭得頭破血流。

sentences.english: He argued with the boss until he was blue in the face.
sentences.chinese: 他和老闆爭得面紅耳赤。

sentences.english: So as to win in the world culture should be the seat of the forest.
sentences.chinese: 這樣才能在世界文化之林中爭得應有之席。

sentences.english: Kit shared his views and we had a lot of good arguments.
sentences.chinese: 基特和傑克遜的觀點一樣，我們常常爭得面紅耳赤。
